item.title: QTB: thetrainline.com - 'Scale at speed'
item.description: About 18 months on from the first ThoughtWorks QTB that I saw about offshoring, on Wednesday night I attended the latest QTB in Manchester titled ‘thetrainline.com - Scale at speed’. The presenters were thetrainline.com’s CIO David Jack and the Managing Director of ThoughtWorks India, Mahesh Baxi. They took us on the journey that thetrainline.com have taken while working with ThoughtWorks to re-architect part of their system to allow them to quickly deliver new functionality on the 2,500 websites that their portal technology powers.

item.title: QTB: Agile Governance - Managing the Enterprise Issues
item.description: I went to watch the latest ThoughtWorks Australia Quarterly Technology Briefing in Sydney on Wednesday where my colleague Lindy Stephens, Suncorp’s Josh Melville and Lonely Planet’s Nigel Dalton presented on ‘Agile Governance - Managing the Enterprise Issues’. item.title: QTB: Agile Adoption - How to stuff it up
item.description: I attended the most recent ThoughtWorks Quarterly Technology briefing on Tuesday which was titled ‘Agile Adoption - How to stuff it up’ and presented by my colleagues Andy Marks and Martin Fowler. There seems to be quite a few books out at the moment about how to introduce a more agile approach into your organisation - I’ve been reading Lean-Agile Software Development and Becoming Agile and there is also a book called Scaling Lean and Agile Development - so I was intrigued to see whether the messages from this talk would be similar to those in these books.
